entry.title: Cross Ange: Tenshi to Ryuu no Rondo

data.content: They both feature female characters who possess magical abilities that are used during battles, and focus on military themes such as weaponry and war. Both series often include busty girl designs and some scenes containing yuri undertones. There’s also a lot of drama and gory violence in both shows. A difference is that Cross Ange is a mecha show while Asuka is more mahou shoujo. If you enjoy or are looking for a dark anime with strong female characters and enormous amounts of action then these could be intriguing fits to watch.

Modern Chinese stop-motion with meticulously choreographed fights. They're very stylish, showing great attention to detail in how the clothes or the hair moves when a puppet runs or fights. Denglong Dao has monsters and more dialogue, but like Fengyu Lang Qiao and its sequels tells the story mostly by action.
Compatible genres. Detectives and criminal cases. Reflection on society. Same vibe.

both: - resurected as weak monsters in another world - get much stronger compared with the rest and lead them - evolve differences: - one is more comedic with much more self centered MC whiled the other accentuates the growth of the other characters along with the MC
Same world environment, humanity surviving against powerful monsters that keep attacking. The main characters share a common mindset, and go through similar events on a personal level.

both are very philosophical and dark, deeply written characters and themes of trauma, abuse, war, love and hate, life and death, interpersonal relationships, the human condition. even if you've already watched brotherhood, the original fma is a completely different beast (and a way better one, in my opinion. brotherhood does not tackle the subjects that 2003 does, in fact it barely brushes up against them). there are a lot of little details and care that went into each of these series. the main difference in these series is that evangelion is less about the characters and world and more about the themes and the message anno is trying to convey while seamlessly integrating characters and world into it, and fma is more focused on the characters and world while seamlessly integrating philosophy and themes into it.

- School club setting - Beautiful scenery when characters get immersed in their respective sports - Team sports, revolving around teamwork - The MC play in an underdog team - Characters with unique personalities and designs - Amazing development of bonds between boys, teammates
Very similar character dynamics
Both have peculiar main characters who focus on physical exercise. Both have powerful secondary friends characters. Both employ comedy aspects too yet have a good story

both are schizophrenic comedic fever dreams where absurdity and violence run rampant (although the violence is a bit more graphic in BTD). BTD is also more sexualized/fanservice-y. there are times in both shows, that i quite truthfully got them confused one time trying to remember a scene, where there are absurd situations that happen and the main character says to the affect "is anyone else seeing this" but everyone else acts like it isn't happening or that it's completely normal. if you find laughter in absurdity and over-the-top situations, this might just be for you.

entry.title: Shinmai Ossan Boukensha, Saikyou Party ni Shinu hodo Kitaerarete Muteki ni Naru.
Ore wa Subete wo "Parry" suru: Gyaku Kanchigai no Sekai Saikyou wa Boukensha ni Naritai

data.content: both comedies of misunderstandings, MCs who think they are bad even though they are very strong.
Both of them are action-filled dark stories with great complex characters with a supernatural element to them.

They both feature great characters and awesome battles with excellent color laden visuals. Both also have good English dubs and do incorporate sci-fi elements like advanced technology as well as characters who possess superhuman powers. In T&B, each superhero possesses an ability known as “NEXT” while individuals in Promare gain “burning flames”. The main difference between them is that Tiger & Bunny revolves around superhero themes whereas Promare focuses on mutated beings. If you are looking for an action-packed sci-fi anime with superpowers and cool characters then these two are gems that are very truly worth checking out.

Similarities: -Both series have great characters and awesome battles accompanied by stunning visuals. -They both feature a storyline that focuses on superheroes possessing super powers to fight dangers that often happen and to protect their city. -Both anime are comedy-heavy action with very funny moments. -They both take place on earth and most of the cast within these shows are adult (grownups). -Protagonists who have names that are part of their identities, One Punch Man (Saitama himself) and Wild Tiger (Kotetsu). These two series are enjoyable to watch and I’d say are marvelous. Please check both of them out for a superhero anime with tons of lit action and good characters.

-They both focus on magic and adventuring within a fantasy setting. -Both have romantic-comedy elements and weaponry featuring lighthearted moments and character relationships as well as magical weapons that the characters use during battles. -The protagonist interacts with various female characters, and that the heroine who’s a pink-haired girl guides him although the archetypes vary. -They both contain some ecchi. While the storylines between them differ, there are actually quite a lot of similarities as well, and if you are looking for a magic oriented fantasy anime with romantic and comedic elements then these two might be worth checking out.
The overall feel is somewhat similar and both shows do a good job at building a world the reader wants to be in

Both center around young female protagonists dealing with alien invasions, providing a rich exploration of adolescence under extraordinary circumstances. They also delve deeply into the psychological and emotional states of their young characters, exploring themes of fear, anxiety, and the heavy burden of responsibilities thrust upon them and both offer complex character portrayals and social commentary, addressing societal issues such as media influence, government control, and the pressures of growing up.

If you liked The Lost Village or were disappointed but still liked the theme/plot/story then don't worry you have a great alternative to watch the better version of it which is Summertime rendering. Summertime Render explores themes of trauma, identity, and the supernatural. If you’re looking for a similar blend of mystery, suspense, and rural Japanese setting, Summertime Render is a good recommendation.

entry.title: Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai: Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen

data.content: The shows are set in an elite, prestigious school and the main characters are members of an association, also, one of the MC's are from an ordinary background in both stories. I would mostly recommend Kaguya-sama and OHSHC for rom-com fans who love the rich-poor trope since there is much emphasis on their class differences. However, I think anyone can enjoy these shows, both are an entertaining and hilarious watch with goofy teenage romance.

"My Deer Friend Nokotan" and "Squid Girl" are both absurd gag comedies involving a human/animal girl coming into society and causing havoc. Some other similarities include: -a very meme opening which is catchy but also gets annoying -similar characters, whose primary characterization revolves around a gag -pretty similar styles of humor, which usually revolves around the main character misunderstanding or being misunderstood by those around them The main difference is that "Squid Girl" takes place on the beach while "My Deer Friend Nokotan" is more of a school anime with school-related jokes. If you like one you'll probably like the other though.

entry.title: Seishun Buta Yarou wa Bunny Girl Senpai no Yume wo Minai
Tokidoki Bosotto Russia-go de Dereru Tonari no Alya-san

data.content: - MC are capable, and handle situations seamlessly. They also kinda lazy. - MC are NOT clueless / dumb. - "Harem" but everyone feel like individuals rather a character that chases or gets chased by the love interest. - Each girl have their own story / arc with the MC. - 2 of the Girls are sibling.

entry.title: Hazurewaku no "Joutai Ijou Skill" de Saikyou ni Natta Ore ga Subete wo Juurin suru made

data.content: As soon as I started watching ep 1 it became clear that it not only presents the same proposal as Arifureta but the story is similar. Another world, invocation of the school class, considered the weakest which resulted in his abandonment, thus creating his journey looking for revenge... Just wait until you see what he's going to try to do with the monsters' meat... Dejavu... (And the CGI that appears in several episodes of Arifureta? Well... it's here too)

Both stories are about a forbidden love between a student and a teacher in other words between an adult and a minor so if you didn’t see any problem with the prelude of fruits basket, you will enjoy kotonoha as well. Teachers genders are swapped in both movies which allows you to look at this controversial storyline choice from different perspectives.

entry.title: Tsuki ga Michibiku Isekai Douchuu 2nd Season

data.content: Isekai'd MC with parents from isekai, the relationship between mc and his 'retainers', the running references to samurai age. Kyou kara maou's mc is somewhat more childish than tsuki michi mc. They both fun to watch and has very nice world-building.

- School club setting - Team sports, revolving around teamwork - The sports they play are relatively unknown - The MC's team play in an underdog team but are rivals with a much stronger team - Characters with unique personalities - The MC is "new" to the sport (technically not in Re-main but close enough) - Amazing development of bonds between boys, teammates - Outgoing MC

Classic puppet theater anime that forego the animation and storytelling conventions of their time, both telling historical folktales of Japan, both the story and animation bear obvious similarities due to this, despite the 40+ year age difference.

entry.title: Lv2 kara Cheat datta Motoyuusha Kouho no Mattari Isekai Life

data.content: Both MC power level is very similar a.k.a pretty much god being in term of power scaling on their own representative world both MC lives. I believe Lv2 Cheat plot directing will similar to Isekai Cheat if it have more episodes. The only BIG key different is the Harem genre on Isekai Cheat Magician in my opinion

This is not music drama but if you have liked Beck I feel you may like a soothing slice of life romance anime which is slow-paced along with character developments. This is one of the rare truly adult romance and slice-of-life anime (adult I mean by maturity not hentai) That is why I love this anime and also because it feels very close to real-life romance where there is a mix of different types of personalities. I liked the ending like Beck, it's not forced, it takes its natural course which is what I love about such anime.
Two gag comedy parodies with unhinged high school girls set mainly in school. The comedy in both are very excessive and meme-y so they're very similar in those regards.

I would like to add that in both series there are robots with boobs, which can be pretty large in Godannar. Which makes Godannar somewhat more fanservicey on the mecha boob design level. While piloting, the female sits in front, and the male behind her. In Darling in the Franxx, the female's position is somewhat more lewd though.

1. Strong, independent, and intelligent FMC 2. Intriguing Mysteries 3. Ancient China setting Each female character shows a strong, wise, and independent woman. They aren't easily wavered by a difficult challenge or mystery. Instead, they use their own wits and skills, mystical power and apothecary skills respectively, to solve each mystery that were assigned to by their masters. And both shows are set inside the Emperor's Palace in Ancient China.
You need to pay attentions to details to figure out what is happening for both of these shows. The show hides so much in the details instead of pointing everything straight out.

Both anime features adult-cast with very intricate plot whiling putting an emphasize on character developement. Although they are not similar in theme(one about politics, on about Rakugo), the two shows strikes me as similar in vibes and level of detail. If you appreciate one, you would have an eye for the other as well.

entry.title: Otome Game Sekai wa Mob ni Kibishii Sekai desu
Akuyaku Reijou Level 99: Watashi wa Ura-Boss desu ga Maou dewa Arimasen

data.content: Both of these animes are about the main character being born again into a video game world as a character. In both shows, there is a female character who is always surrounded by a harrm.

entry.title: Nejimaki Seirei Senki: Tenkyou no Alderamin

data.content: Both "Alderamin on the Sky" and "Lord Marksman and Vanadis" pack too much story in too little. Both are echhi-battle themed anime. We've a talented, powerful hero protagonist being aided by an equally powerful female protagonist. In both anime there's the task of protecting Princess too and the protagonist's kingdom is full of vices, corrupt nobles, useless king and scheming elites. However "Alderamin on the Sky" is too hard-core whereas "Lord Marksman and Vanadis" is faithful to its genre theme and somewhat easy on the eyes and mind.👍🏻
Both animes are outlandish to the extreme, blending unique and awe-inspiring visuals with pure thrill.
Femme fatale female leads who use their sexuality as a weapon and psychedelic visuals.
The two may not belong to the same genre, but they share a similar essence. Behind both of them, it feels as if workers are operating behind the scenes of an overall bigger complex operation.

There are a lot of common things in both series: -Both are ecchi-harems as the protagonist is a perv who’s surrounded by numerous female characters who frequently act flirtatiously and are showcased in suggestive scenarios that particularly include pantsu leading to an abundance of fanservice. -They both focus on romantic-comedy with an emphasis on intimate situations and character relationships as well as comedic themes that include playful interactions, awkward misunderstands, and characters feeling overly compromised. -Both feature a school setting. -They both incorporate science-fiction elements in the form of the female characters being alien hybrid humans. -For some reason, both series are considered shounen and have a lighthearted tone. If you are specifically looking for an anime with attractive female characters, sci-fi elements, romance, comedy, and plenty of ecchi-ness, then both SNO and TLV will be just the perfect choices.

Both are about a survival game and focus on the MC and his friends from school. Both have the same type of twists at the end of the episodes. Both can work as a type of comedy, depending on how you see both shows.

Time travels narratives that revolve around the the goal of preventing a pre-determined outcome while opposed by a larger organization. Protagonists slowly move past their facades propped up by either Vivy's programmed mission or Okabe's personal insecurities as their worldview shifts through interactions caused by their new goals. Comedy is interspersed to cut between the darker undertones within both shows, usually through a comic relief character.

Want some fun? These two works will guarantee it. Although Moomin is much more about the characters' daily lives and crazy adventures, Little Witch Academia has a bit of that too. Moomin isn't about witches, but there are witches too. Both have somewhat unique casts (Moomin more so. Little Witch Academia has some slightly more generic characters, but they're just a few).

1. Big monster adapts an abandoned little girl 2. Little girl is an adorable child 3. Set in a fantasy setting Humanoid monster is seen fostering a girl. Both shows depicts that even a monster can become a father-figure to a child without any relationship or ill-intention.

1. Big monster adapts an abandoned little girl 2. Little girl is an adorable child 3. Traveling in a fantasy world Humanoid monster is seen fostering a girl while traveling to search for the last human civilization to save her. Both shows depicts that even a monster can become a father-figure to a child without any relationship or ill-intention.

Gorgeous depictions of food, lovingly animated lessons on how to make it and compelling lore on how the monsters exist and interact in their environment all with a dark undertone about what lurks deeper inside. Both series have this with Toriko focusing on more raw, visceral and creative fights while Dungeon Meshi has amazingly entertaining character interactions.

Both series are about a boy who's unable to use magic in a world where magic is everything, so he goes to the magic school by focusing on the use of his sword mastery, which allows him to match and even surpass magic users with his sheer skill.
Two series originating from VA's, MAnG coming from Sora Tokui and EL coming from Takuya Eguchi. MAnG makes more sense in plot although shorter than EL and EL is a lot more shitposty compared to.

Somewhat similar vibe with the fact that popular VA's are used in acting in both shows that aren't that serious and somewhat feel a bit shitposty at times, EL really embracing that vibe whereas TnES has a bit more sense to it but is mainly just small snippets of stuff.
Both these anime focus on absurd gag comedy starring crazy school girls. There isnt much overall plot and stories of episodes are out of nowhere, absurd.

entry.title: Sono Bisque Doll wa Koi wo Suru

data.content: Each female lead has a very strong interest in cosplay and the male MC's in both series get brought along for the ride to help them out with methods such as photographing them and positively influencing them for their passion of the hobby!

Both series revolve around a game word where MC is stuck as their in game avatar after the game world becomes a reality. The stories both involve a time skip 200 years for leadale and 500 years for new gate where the MC reawakens after time has passed. Both MC maintain their skill levels as their in game avatar and their powers are legendary known throughout the game world as a prominent figure. Leadale has a female MC and new gate is male but they both have the same goal of reconciling with their companions and make it adventurous. Leadale has much better quality than new gate but new gate has better action compared to leadale.

Gyaru. I am surprised that no one added Hajimete yet, but they have similar feels to them. Dosanko doesn't have any real conflict in it though and is just a warm fuzzy while Hajimete has a few trials that the pair has to overcome.

Both pieces of media have an overarching feeling of melancholy and nostalgia, despite both shows being comedies. They both feature alien invasions, but the main focus is the character interactions between the cast.
both are fairly realistic in their setting. they handle the themes of aristocracy, and both have somewhat miraculous technology that's used as the catalyst for all of the events.

Both tell the story of a young man who wants to get into a sport as a complete beginner who meets a prodigy of this same sport. Both train with multiple problems, but with the help of a cast of companions who, through the effort and courage of working in team fight to reach an important tournament

entry.title: Boku no Tsuma wa Kanjou ga Nai

data.content: Two sci-fi romcoms about a man living on his own with his affectionate female robot. The two robots in both follow through strict manual instructions but along the way would go through some kind of change in behaviour no longer acting as just the standard robot. Main difference is that Bokutsuma's MC is a working salaryman whereas Chobits' MC is in college, also there is more drama and a deeper lore in Chobits (subject to change depending on how Bokutsuma goes).
Both have hilarious absurd humor with unexpected twists during jokes

Both stories are about a journey through fantastical, scary, otherworldly, hillarious and bizzare realities, the end destination of which is achieving an understanding or forgiveness with those closest to us. Also, both are really good shows.
Both shows are about a world where large, medium and small monsters invade a city, and how a specialized squad is responsible for eliminating them.

Cute girls cheerleading in a small group of 5 that does go up against a much bigger cheerleading group. Personalities between the main girls are quite similar in both tho there are little differences but still fairly similar. They both have their moments of lighthearted fun and serious drama moments within the story but nothing too majorly soap opera-like.

data.content: Both shows explore the absurd relationships the main characters end up after their divorced parents re marriage will they be brother and sister or love buds?
Slow-paced, melancholic, character-driven shows. Similar in art style, as well as in general vibes.

entry.title: Kino no Tabi: The Beautiful World - The Animated Series

data.content: Both of these are short storys that focus on the time we spend vs the destination. Both make you feel something.

Adult 18+ anime (hentai) with strong female protagonist. Both shows have similar theme of the eerie aesthetics of blood-sputtering violence. Oh and back in the days these shows do have a coherent plot.

Same old cosy feel. I mean Kinoko Nasu literally bases his main character trio of the Evangelion trio archetype. Also has crazy nonesensical alternate timeline rabbit holes to go down if you like seeing alternate routes.

Both main characters were legendary heroes that had super overpowered skills but decided to quit the life of being a hero and try to live a slow and quiet life at a leisurely pace. However, despite their best efforts blending in with society they both encounter troubles that require them to transform once again in order to resolve conflicts; I think Hero Return has much better action and fight choreography but I Quit Heroing has better overall quality because Hero Return feels more comparatively low quality.

entry.title: Ore dake Level Up na Ken

data.content: Both Anime's show great proggression thru the main characters where both follow almost the same path to success

Stop-motion short films about Japanese folklores, The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter (also known as The Tale of Princess Kaguya) in Kaguya-hime and Momotaro or Peach Boy in Mukashi Mukashi Momotarou. These might interest those who like folklores and stop-motion animation.

Similar kinda story structure, where most of it are absurd comedy sketches, but then it actually serves unironically to flesh out the characters and form a path moving forward. Plus, it's all kickstarted by the arrival of a surreal character that needs to be taken care of by the delinquent protagonist of the story.

If you're hankering for a fantasy adventure that feels like MDZS, Akatsuki no Yona's a fantastic watch. A carefree childhood with a storm brewing that blows over when they're adults, heartfelt moments, unexpected allies, on a long journey - there were so many similar elements. While MDZS in its Donghua and Danmei versions is a complete story, Akatsuki no Yona's 24 episodes end around chapter 40-41 of the manga.

Films based on the folklore "The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter" with distinct animation styles, stop-motion in Kaguya-hime and impressionistic in Kaguya-hime no Monogatari. The stop-motion animation for Kaguya-hime was nicely done for its time and of course Kaguya-hime no Monogatari's old-fashioned hand-drawn animation is a visual feast. The stories were close to the original however in Kaguya-hime, only three suitors along with the emperor were shown (Prince Kuramochi with the jeweled branch from a tree, Prince Ishitsukuri with Buddha's stone bowl, and Grand Counselor Otomo with the five-colored jade that shines from the dragon’s neck; Lord Minister of the Right Abe with the robe of fire-rat fur and Middle Counselor Isonokami with the cowrie shell that swallow warms as a treasure and a charm for safe birth were shown along with the other three suitors and the emperor in Kaguya-hime no Monogatari).

Die Busters is a spiritual prequel to Gurren Lagann also created by Gainax that shows us an incursion of the great magnitudes of space robotics and delirious humor, drama and escalation that both shows show

entry.title: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 5: Ougon no Kaze

data.content: Both shows are about members of mafias that are at war, characters with supernatural powers, a high intellect to fight, bizarre, varied and colorful personalities, and a mix of humor and drama that can be considered a show for both adults and young people.

Like comedy and hard breaking fight scenes with the 90's feel? then here you go, one of the most funniest yet hardest sh*t I've seen in my life. If you like the chemistry between the characters of YuYuHakusho then you will enjoy it even more as all the characters feel like they are your own siblings but not actual characters. Lastly, the adventure. No words could explain it.

These animes both portray the harshness of what life brings to you. Erased and Orange both bring supernatural events such as time travel complications to try and bring out different events to help prevent the life changing event that the protagonist wants to not face again. These animes both utilize past trauma as a motive to try and produce a different outcome with the help of the time travel mechanic. I definitely recommend both of these animes as they were fun, sad and beautiful to watch.

entry.title: Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai: Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen

data.content: If you like either one of these romance animes then I guarantee you that you will like the other one. The characters in both Horimiya and Kaguyasama Love Is War make the anime as good as it is due to the dynamics they create when the characters interact with one another. Also, the romance in both of these animes are phenomenal and make me wanna watch more even though there aren't more episodes.

In my opinion, both of these animes are masterpieces as if you have watched either one of them you would instantly understand why. I want to eat your pancreas and A silent voice both have these gut wrenching scenes that can change the way you think about life. These anime movies are life changing so go watch them!

These animes are both mechas that are really amazing. What makes the characters special are that they all go through mental struggles that help to make the characters feel more real and human. Also, 86 does use cgi for the mechs but it is the best cgi i have ever seen, if anything I will forever defend the use of cgi for the mechas only because of the high quality of cgi. I do prefer animation over cgi but in this case I prefer the cgi.

They both have time travel elements, however in my opinion Summertime Render does the time travel mechanic better by adding consequences for dying. It is explained in Summertime Render that when he dies, his respawn time goes closer to when he dies each time he dies. They are both really good animes. Steins gate is more mainstream but Summertime Render is definitely an underrated gem.

Both themes are based on exploring an unknown place, the deep or the dungeon. The characters are in both anime very well-built and in both series, there are traces of crude events (a bit less crude in dungeon meshi).
Both shows broach themes such as romantic relations between humans and artificial beings such as robots and androids with all the difficulties it implies (memory storage, virus, moral ect...)

Both shows take place in feudal Japan, revolving around a mysterious and skilled girl who is related in mysterious ways to an Asian monarchy. Also Both shows have incredible art direction - animation and a charismatic girl main character, who tries to hide her beauty
